intro: Sunaptea parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved sunaptea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
